answers.answer: Hi, Skeeter.  I'm not a medical professional, just a parent of a kid with diabetes.  From what I've learned, diabetes affects the nerves more than tendons.  But I have had sore and swollen feet and knees.  Ice and keeping it elevated always help me.
She may need to see a podiatrist. If the problem is indeed swollen tendons, the root cause needs to be addressed before she will see relief. Has her doctor checked for heel spurs?

question: My mom has been suffering of pain in her left heel for about 1 month now. Her dr. has said her tendons are swolen and prescribed her some tylenol with codine. But they have not helped. Her foot is only more swollen now and more pain. Can anyone tell me if they have experienced this and what I can do to help.
title: My 54 year old Diabetic mother suffers from pain in her Heel
